name: Execute CP/M 2.2 programs on Arduino DUE
short_description:
This project aims at turning the Arduino DUE into a Z80 emulator running CP/M 2.2.
The CP/M code is a fork of my RunCPM project (http://sourceforge.net/projects/runcpm/).
Right now everything is working and many different vintage CP/M applications have been tested on it.
Applications like Microsoft Basic-80, Cobol-80, Fortran, Wordstar, dBaseII and others have all been tested and are working correctly.
I haven't tested with other applications, but everyone is welcome to give it a spin and report their findings.

It needs the latest Arduino SdFat library, and I am using the Wireless/SD shield, but it may work with any other shield that has a SD card on it (may requite to change the SDcs pin in the code). 

When building the SD card, leave the CPM22.bin on the root of the card, and make folders called A, B, C and so on, which will be treated as each disk drive.
Then just load those "disk drives" with software and off you go.

Source files are available under the "Files" tab.
summary: Emulates the CP/M 2.2 BIOS and BDOS calls inside the Arduino board
